natural problem: What is the value of the sum $\frac{2}{3}+\frac{2^2}{3^2}+\frac{2^3}{3^3}+ \ldots +\frac{2^{10}}{3^{10}}$? Express your answer as a common fraction.
natural solution: This is the sum of the series $a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{10}$ with $a_1 = \frac{2}{3}$ and $r = \frac{2}{3}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n :: nat and s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. s n = (2 powr n) / (3 powr n)"
and h1 : "s 10 = (\<Sum> i \<in> {1..10}. s i)"
shows  "s 10 = 116050 / 59049"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of the sum $\frac{2}{3}+\frac{2^2}{3^2}+\frac{2^3}{3^3}+ \ldots +\frac{2^{10}}{3^{10}}$? Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{116050}{59049}
 ### Proof
 This is the sum of the series $a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{10}$ with $a_1 = \frac{2}{3}$ and $r = \frac{2}{3}$.
 Thus,  \begin{align} S &= \frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r}= \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1-\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^{10}}{1-\frac{2}{3}}\\ & = \frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{1-\frac{1024}{59049}}{\frac{1}{3}}=\frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{3}{1}\cdot\frac{58025}{59049}=\frac{2\cdot58025}{59049}\\
 & = \boxed{\frac{116050}{59049}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n :: nat and s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. s n = (2 powr n) / (3 powr n)"
and h1 : "s 10 = (\<Sum> i \<in> {1..10}. s i)"
shows  "s 10 = 116050 / 59049"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: The sequence $s_n$ is defined for all natural numbers $n$ by $s_n = \frac{2^n}{3^n}$. If the 10th term of this sequence is equal to the sum of the first 10 terms of the sequence, find the 10th term. The final answer is $\frac{116050}{59049}$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. f n = (2 powr n) / (3 powr n)"
shows  "sum f {1..10} = 116050 / 59049"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem

 ### Proof
 This is the sum of the series $a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{10}$ with $a_1 = \frac{2}{3}$ and $r = \frac{2}{3}$.
 Thus,  \begin{align} S &= \frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r}= \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1-\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^{10}}{1-\frac{2}{3}}\\ & = \frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{1-\frac{1024}{59049}}{\frac{1}{3}}=\frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{3}{1}\cdot\frac{58025}{59049}=\frac{2\cdot58025}{59049}\\
 & = \boxed{\frac{116050}{59049}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. f n = (2 powr n) / (3 powr n)"
shows  "sum f {1..10} = 116050 / 59049"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Calculate the sum of the sequence defined by $f(n) = \frac{2^n}{3^n}$ for all natural numbers $n$ from $1$ to $10$. The final answer is $\frac{116050}{59049}$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n :: nat and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. f n = (2 ^ n) / (3 ^ n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. n \<le> 10 \<longrightarrow> sum f {..n} = 116050 / 59049"
shows  "sum f {..10} = 116050 / 59049"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of the sum $\frac{2}{3}+\frac{2^2}{3^2}+\frac{2^3}{3^3}+ \ldots +\frac{2^{10}}{3^{10}}$? Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{116050}{59049}
 ### Proof
 This is the sum of the series $a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{10}$ with $a_1 = \frac{2}{3}$ and $r = \frac{2}{3}$.
 Thus,  \begin{align} S &= \frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r}= \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1-\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^{10}}{1-\frac{2}{3}}\\ & = \frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{1-\frac{1024}{59049}}{\frac{1}{3}}=\frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{3}{1}\cdot\frac{58025}{59049}=\frac{2\cdot58025}{59049}\\
 & = \boxed{\frac{116050}{59049}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n :: nat and f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. f n = (2 ^ n) / (3 ^ n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. n \<le> 10 \<longrightarrow> sum f {..n} = 116050 / 59049"
shows  "sum f {..10} = 116050 / 59049"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Given a sequence where each term is defined by $f(n) = \frac{2^n}{3^n}$ for a natural number $n$, find the sum of the first 10 terms of this sequence. The final answer is $\frac{116050}{59049}$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 10 \<longrightarrow> f n = 2 powr n / 3 powr n"
shows  "(\<Sum> n = 1..10. f n) = 116050 / 59049"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of the sum $\frac{2}{3}+\frac{2^2}{3^2}+\frac{2^3}{3^3}+ \ldots +\frac{2^{10}}{3^{10}}$? Express your answer as a common fraction. The final Answer is \frac{116050}{59049}
 ### Proof
 This is the sum of the series $a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{10}$ with $a_1 = \frac{2}{3}$ and $r = \frac{2}{3}$.
 Thus,  \begin{align} S &= \frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r}= \frac{2}{3} \cdot \frac{1-\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^{10}}{1-\frac{2}{3}}\\ & = \frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{1-\frac{1024}{59049}}{\frac{1}{3}}=\frac{2}{3}\cdot\frac{3}{1}\cdot\frac{58025}{59049}=\frac{2\cdot58025}{59049}\\
 & = \boxed{\frac{116050}{59049}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 10 \<longrightarrow> f n = 2 powr n / 3 powr n"
shows  "(\<Sum> n = 1..10. f n) = 116050 / 59049"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Find the sum of the series $f(n) = \frac{2^n}{3^n}$ for all natural numbers $n$ in the range $1 \leq n \leq 10$. The final answer is $\frac{116050}{59049}$.
